revised_title: Fairy-Rings: The Role of Fungi in Pasture Circle Formation
tldr: The author investigates the formation of fairy-rings in pastures, discovering that they are caused by fungi that absorb all nutrients from the soil, leading to the growth of a dark ring of grass. The fungi's growth progresses in a circular pattern, and other plants struggle to grow within the ring due to the lack of nutrients. The author also observes that different species of fungi require the same nutrients, causing interference between circles when they overlap.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Science
